title: What trends will intersect this decade? - Quora

response.answer_text: The recognition of Feminism as the Great Harlot will be recognized as the Political Left. Feminism has sat upon every empire or Kingdom that every rose up to great heights, but then Fell. Social Science:  Religion: Rev. 18:1 And after these things, (the vial of wrath against the paganism of sexual exploitations of men which culminates in the ancient ritual and oath taking where Matrimony is coupled with No Fault Divorce), I saw, (of the seven), another angel come down, (another vision), from heaven, (ie; David Judah Layb: [Rev 5:5]), having great power; and the earth was lightened with his glory. Rev. 18:2 And he cried mightily with a strong voice, saying, Babylon the great, (it's Feminist sexual promiscuity), is fallen (in that she is revealed), is fallen (and exposed), and is become (clearly perceived sociologically), the habitation of (she)-devils, and the hold of every foul (prostituting) spirit, and a cage of every unclean (relationship) and hateful (homosexual) bird.  (Temple of Ishtar, the great harlot of Babylon) Rev. 18:3 For all nations (throughout time immemorial) have drunk of the wine (and roses) of the wrath (to follow) of (the paganized sexual promiscuity), her fornication (and her seductions), and the kings of the earth have committed fornication with her (in the name of economic complicity), and the merchants of the earth are waxed rich through the abundance (of products and services required to accommodate the desires) of her delicacies.

Peer-to-peer lending and payments have reduced the cost of transactions and loans and might affect more people and businesses soon.  The trend fits neatly into our culture of:  1) distrust for traditional banks 2) excitement over sharing economy (airbnb, zipcar, lyft) and 3) increasing self-employment Peer-to-peer transactions make up a small share of all loans and payments now, but I'm interested to see how this trend could grow.  Some other people who think similarly: Why peer-to-peer payments could be as big as the internet  Crowdfunding: the end of banking as we know it? Peer-to-Peer Lending Is Poised to Grow

The uprising of the Alt-Right (yech) The true death of brick and mortar stores. Millennials taking over. Superhero films becoming the new myths. The rise of Disney as a monopoly of entertainment The Death of Print.
